Version: 3.0.1
Build id: 200409161125

Third-party plugins installed:

Red Robin Jython 1.3.6 - Jython IDE plugins for Eclipse
http://home.tiscali.be/redrobin/jython/

-----

ISSUE:

A third party plugin appears to be breaking default JDT behaviour.  If this is
allowed, then there is no issue.

-----

BACKGROUND

This seems to be specific to my configuration/plugins but I figured I would
report the defect anyway.  I couldn't find another bug detailing this problem.

I used 3.0 for a while and then updated it to 3.0.1 using the Help --> Software
Updates.

Now my Package Explorer view is broken but in an inconsistent way.  Here are a
few of the breakages:

- can't disconnect projects from CVS. Team --> Disconnect... isn't there for
projects I've checked out from CVS, but Apply Patch... and Share Project... are
there but disabled.

- when I right-click on SOME (not all) projects, there are no icons on the New
sub-menu.  Sometimes the icons are there but the alignment of the text overlaps
them.  Sometimes they appear normally.

- can't close SOME projects (sometimes Open Project is there but disabled,
sometimes it's not there at all)

The Red Robin Jython plugins could very well be messing with my Java projects
but a plugin shouldn't be allowed mess with default JDT behaviour, should it? 
Red Robin supports Jython in Java projects, which may be why it changes the Java
Project behaviour in the Package Explorer.

-----

REPRODUCIBILITY

If I go to Help --> Software Updates --> Manage Configuration... and disable Red
Robin (Jython Feature 1.3.6), then the strange behaviour goes away.

If I go back and re-enable the Red Robin feature, the bevahiour returns.

-----

POSSIBLE SOLUTIONS

I *could* update Red Robin to the latest version (1.3.9), but that might make
this problem go away.  As silly as that sounds, if plugins are not supposed to
change the default behaviour of JDT I don't want to update so that I can
reproduce this problem until you guys have a chance to fix Eclipse.

If plugins *are* allowed to modify/break JDT then this is a Red Robin issue.

Created an attachment (id=14781)
No icons in the New submenu

Created an attachment (id=14782)
Close Project missing and Open Project disabled

Created an attachment (id=14783)
no Disconnect... and Share Project... disabled

I emailed the creator of the Red Robin Jython plugin to tell him I reported this
bug and this was his reply to me by email.  This reply may help you with a fix
to be more defensive against "misbehaving" plugins.

===

Hello Ryan,

Thanks for reporting the problem. I do not know whether I can add
comment to the bug report, so here is my comment. Maybe you like to add
it to the bug report.

Version 1.3.6 of the plug-in may raise an exception when
enabling/disabling the menu commands that are added to the project menu.
The problem has been fixed in 1.3.9. From the release notes:

	Fixed a class cast exception in the code triggered to enable or
disable the Remove Jython Nature command.

The exception gave rise to different problems, such as the menu not
showing, but your problem is new to me. Eclipse should put an exception
handler around all invocations of methods that are not part of Eclipse
plug-ins. That is an Eclipse guideline. Eclipse fails to do so in this
case.

The addition of the two menu commands for adding and removing the Jython
nature is implemented with an object contribution extension point for
Iproject instances. The Red Robin plug-in does not change or influence
JDT behavior whatsoever.

Regards,
RR

Moving to Platform/UI for comments.

Comment 4 indicates that a ClassCastException in an object contribution can
cause harm to independent contributions from other plugins.

Ryan, was there anything of interest in your eclipse log file?  Stack traces,
for instance?

Yep my bad, it turns out there were stack traces in the .log file.  They all
appear to be the same.
